intro: Paratephrosia, commonly known as the pink-flowered mistletoe, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Loranthaceae. These parasitic plants are characterized by their lack of chlorophyll and reliance on host trees for nutrients. They produce small, showy flowers that are often pink or white in color. Paratephrosia species are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Their reproductive structures are adapted for pollination by insects and birds.
